instruction: What machine learning models were used in the proposed method for detecting and mapping parthenium weed populations in simulated pastoral environments using Red-Green-Blue (RGB) and/or hyperspectral imagery aided by artificial intelligence?
Output:
The machine learning models used in the proposed method for detecting and mapping parthenium weed populations are:

1. YOLOv4 Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) implementation: This model was used for processing RGB images. It achieved an overall accuracy of 95% for detection and 86% for classification of flowering and non-flowering stages of the weed.

2. XGBoost classifier: This model was used for pixel classification of the hyperspectral dataset. It achieved a classification accuracy of 99% for each parthenium weed growth stage class.

Both models were utilized to aid in the detection and mapping of parthenium weed populations in simulated pastoral environments.
